wikipedia_page.main: Morag Joss was born in England in 1955 and from the age of four grew up in Ayrshire, Scotland. She became a writer in 1996 after an early career in arts and museum management.

response: * Silver Dagger: Morag Joss, Half-Broken Things
Half Broken Things is a 2003 psychological thriller novel by Scottish writer Morag Joss. It won the CWA Silver Dagger in 2003.

Courses include fiction, non-fiction, poetry, playwriting, travel writing and song writing courses given by names such as Morag Joss, William McIlvanney, Carol Ann Duffy, Andrew O'Hagan, Alasdair Gray, Findlay Napier and Bella Hardy.
